title: Fetus and newborn affected by surgical procedure on mother
chapter: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period
block: Fetus and newborn affected by maternal factors and by complications of pregnancy, labour and delivery
category: Fetus and newborn affected by maternal conditions that may be unrelated to present pregnancy
inclusion: conditions that have their origin in the perinatal period even though death or morbidity occurs later
the listed maternal conditions only when specified as a cause of mortality or morbidity in fetus or newborn
exclusion: congenital malformations, deformations and chromosomal abnormalities
injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes
fetus and newborn affected by: maternal complications of pregnancy
fetus and newborn affected by: maternal endocrine and metabolic disorders
fetus and newborn affected by: noxious influences transmitted via placenta or breast milk
damage to placenta from amniocentesis, caesarean section or surgical induction
previous surgery to uterus or pelvic organs
